title: Gives peace officers status to local court security personnel outside the city of New York
summary: Grants peace officer status to local personnel furnishing security services for courts outside the city of New York, as their only duty; requires training as approved by the chief administrator of the courts.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3376

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. CALHOUN, CROUCH -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.
         THIELE -- read once and referred to the Committee on Codes

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  criminal procedure law, in relation to security
         services in the courts

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  2.10 of the criminal procedure law is amended by
    2  adding a new subdivision 83 to read as follows:
    3    83. A PERSON EMPLOYED BY A COUNTY OR CITY OUTSIDE OF NEW YORK CITY WHO
    4  IS SPECIALLY DESIGNATED BY SUCH COUNTY OR CITY, OR AN APPROPRIATE  OFFI-
    5  CER  THEREOF, TO PERFORM NO FUNCTION OR DUTY OTHER THAN THE PROVISION OF
    6  SECURITY SERVICES IN THE COURTS.
    7    S 2. Section 2.30 of the criminal procedure law is amended by adding a
    8  new subdivision 7 to read as follows:
    9    7. NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS  SECTION,
   10  THE  TRAINING  REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS FOR PERSONS WHO ARE PEACE
   11  OFFICERS PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION EIGHTY-THREE OF SECTION  2.10  OF  THIS
   12  ARTICLE  SHALL  BE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR OF THE
   13  COURTS.
   14    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   15  it shall have become a law.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02829-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to security services in the courts
